At Alight, we believe a company’s success starts with its people. At our core, we Champion People, help our colleagues Grow with Purpose and true to our name we encourage colleagues to “Be Alight.”

Our Values:

Champion People – be empathetic and help create a place where everyone belongs.

Grow with purpose – Be inspired by our higher calling of improving lives.

Be Alight – act with integrity, be real and empower others.

It’s why we’re so driven to connect passion with purpose. Our team’s expertise in human insights and cloud technology gives companies and employees around the world the ability to power confident decisions, for life.

With a comprehensive total rewards package, continuing education and training, and tremendous potential with a growing global organization, Alight is the perfect place to put your passion to work.

Join our team if you Champion People, want to Grow with Purpose through acting with integrity and if you embody the meaning of Be Alight.

Learn more at careers.alight.com.

Key Responsibilities

The individual will be involved in the following critical activities:
• Collaborating with a world-class team of Product Designers, UX Design - Researchers & Content designers
• Designs creative solutions for real world problems that help people and organizations thrive
• Crafts user scenarios, user flows, information architecture (IA) and pixel-perfect mockups and prototypes that include compelling interactions for websites, mobile apps, native apps and more
• Prototype, test, and iterate on designs; evaluates usability of existing systems as well as preliminary designs
• Presents research, strategy and design work to internal clients for review
• Collaborates effectively with developers, strategists, product managers, executives, Creative Directors and other designers to craft solutions for a variety of different platforms and industries
• Participate in collaborative client discovery and design workshops and participates in ideations
• Motivates and champions Design at all times
• Experience in multitasking and working in ambiguous situations
• Help support a shared design vision across the company by building consensus on priorities leading to product design and execution
• Grow a culture of design and ship with speed, consistency, and quality; rebuilding our culture

Knowledge, Education, Certification, Skills & Technical Proficiencies

The ideal experience and critical competencies for the role include the following:
• Live and breathe to design the future and have a portfolio (product, websites, apps, etc) to prove
• Experience with or background in visual design
• Proven UX/UI design skills
• Online portfolio of in-market examples of successful user interface design, focused on web and mobile
• Fluency in best practices for information architecture and interaction design, life-centered design process, as well as strong knowledge of user experience principles and techniques
• Knowledge of the end-to-end iterative product design process
• Experience using Figma, Sketch, Miro/Mural, Invision and/or HTML, Javascript & CSS

Work Experience
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent; MS a plus
• Experience using Figma, Sketch, Miro/Mural, Invision and/or HTML, Javascript & CSS

• 2+ years of experience in designer roles at Design or Digital Agencies, Startups, or Fortune 500 companies

Flexible Working

job_description:
Meraki makes setting up and maintaining reliable Internet and Internet-powered devices easier than ever before. We enable organizations everywhere, from local libraries to hotels operating worldwide, to focus on their mission and have technology that simply works.

We’re looking for a product designer to join our team in simplifying IT. As a product designer at Meraki, you will own the design of workflows within a product. Collaborating with partners in product management and engineering, you will gather data and conduct research understand users’ goals, and you will explore and iterate on solutions.

Meraki believes the quality of our products is dependent on the quality of our teams. We place a high value on nurturing the growth and development of everyone on our team. On the design team, we give and get feedback early and often, share what we know, and learn from each other. As a senior product designer, you will mentor other members of the design team and help shape the team’s processes and practices.

Our team’s primary focus is on software, but we also find opportunities to collaborate with teams across the organization and think about how to improve the entire customer journey.

Responsibilities:
• Learn about the domain and workflows of our users.
• Design screens and flows: run and synthesize research, sketch and prototype solutions, make hi-fi visuals.
• Iterate on designs based on peer feedback, user research, usability testing, analytics, and other data.
• Collaborate with partners in product management and engineering. Build effective working relationships and bring the wider team into the design process.
• Present rationale for design decisions.
• Solicit feedback from designers and other collaborators.

You are an ideal candidate if you have examples of how you’ve done some of the following:
• Created designs that solved a problem in a web site, application, or app, and assessed their impact. Shipped designs to target users.
• Created well-crafted and elegant designs that communicate complex messages or support complex workflows.
• Applied principles of graphic design to direct people’s attention and communicate a brand.
• Worked with developers to understand constraints and to ensure that the details are done right.
• Iterated on designs based on user research and feedback.
• Worked within or contributed to a design system.

Qualifications:
• At least one year of experience working full time as a Product Designer or UX Designer.
• You are familiar with all of the following areas, and strong in at least one: research, interaction design, graphic design, front-end code (HTML/CSS). You are eager to learn new skills and deepen your areas of expertise.

Please include a link to your portfolio in your application.

At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.

Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.

U.S. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday, plus a day off for their birthday. Employees accrue up to 20 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) each year and have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues without tapping into their PTO. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. Employees are also able to purchase company stock through our Employee Stock Purchase Program.

Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. Do you have an extensive background and strong opinions about designing web and mobile applications? Do you have experience leading a design team? Do you have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to make independent decisions and implement creative decisions based on user research and customer feedback? If you are passionate about application design and creating awesome user experiences, this role is likely a perfect fit for you!

Join our team to contribute to building products that will reshape the way industries like recruiting and education work:
• TeachTap: Bringing historical figures to life using AI, offering an engaging, TikTok-like learning experience to make learning more relevant and fun (top 80 apps in Education on the AppStore in only a few weeks!)
• TeachTower: A game-based motivation system inspired by popular games like Roblox and Minecraft, designed to make learning irresistibly fun.
• Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent.
We're breaking down geographical barriers and making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.

What we offer:
• The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to adopt a new way of doing design.
• The chance to work on products that are reshaping industries and making a difference in people's lives.

We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our designers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters - a great user experience.

Senior UX Designer key responsibilities

Basic Requirements
• At least 3 years of experience doing hands-on UX design for software products.
• At least 1 year of experience creating designs and clickable prototypes in Figma.
• An openness to heavily use generative AI tools in your day-to-day UX design work.

About Trilogy

Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

Method is part of GlobalLogic, a digital product engineering company. GlobalLogic integrates experience design and complex engineering to help our clients imagine what’s possible and accelerate their transition into tomorrow’s digital businesses. GlobalLogic is a Hitachi Group Company.

As a Senior Product Designer, you will collaborate with multidisciplinary individuals and support the project lead on end to end product design projects from strategy through to execution. You support framing design opportunities with clients, concept explorations, wireframing, prototyping, building developer ready designs, creating design systems (or component libraries) and gathering user feedback to validate and evolve products.

Responsibilities:
• Design converged, multi channel digital solutions with different disciplines in a highly collaborative environment
• Work with multidisciplinary teams on complex projects using agile and/or lean product development
• Collaborate on and influence the different stages of a digital product—this includes product definition, user research efforts, low and high fidelity design, user testing, development and QA
• Contribute to planning, conducting, and interpreting primary and secondary research to inform the user interaction and visual direction of a product. Research methods include user and business stakeholder interviews, usability evaluations, concept validation, and usability testing
• Impact Method through common missions that better serve our projects, our people and the world at large.
• Practice responsible design (accessible and inclusive)
• Participate in a culture of curiosity on the interplay between design, product and technology that manifests in how projects are framed and executed

Qualifications:
• Fluent in English with excellent verbal/written communication and presentation skills. Ability to successfully articulate design concepts and intent to your team and your client
• A portfolio in English that highlights your direct contributions to the full product design process (Discovery → Definition → Design Execution and Developer Handoff). It should follow a case study narrative articulating participation and personal role throughout each project
• Your story/portfolio reflects a solid foundation in understanding the complexity and intricacies of business problems, human needs and how they can be solved through products delivered. Your work to solve these is a perfect blend of form and function
• Demonstrated success in launching digital products and services
• 5+ years professional experience in UI/UX, interaction or digital product design from consultancies, in-house environments etc.
• Effective time management skills to balance project schedule with fast-paced deadlines
• Ability to collaborate with engineers, product managers etc. as it pertains to developing digital products
• A strong, empathetic participant on projects who inspires and encourages their team members to deliver the highest quality work
• A working knowledge of web and mobile technologies, platforms and frameworks (and their constraints)
• Demonstrated mastery of common design tools (Figma, Sketch, etc.). Bonus points for front-end development design skills

Why Method?

We look for individuals who are smart, kind and brave. Curious people with a natural ability to think on their feet, learn fast, and develop points-of-view for a constantly changing world find Method an exciting place to work. Our employees are excited to collaborate with dispersed and diverse teams that bring together the best in thinking and making. We champion the ability to listen, and believe that critique and dissonance lead to better outcomes. We believe everyone has the capacity to lead and look for proactive individuals who can take and give direction, lead by example, enjoy the making as much as they do the thinking, especially at senior and leadership levels.

• Fondo de ahorro

• Parental leave
• Additional benefits including: IMSS, Aguinaldo, food vouchers

Our client is transforming lending for credit unions to enhance the financial well-being of US consumers. The average American carries over $155,000 in household debt. Who You Are

As a Senior Product Designer, you are a seasoned creative problem solver with a minimum of 5 years of experience working in a Product Design role. You have a degree in a relevant field such as HCI, Human Factors, or equivalent work experience. You have a robust portfolio of past projects that showcase your expertise in visual and interaction design skills. As a Senior Product Designer at Formstack, you will take on a leadership role, working with a cross-functional team of Designers, Products Managers, Product Marketers, Engineers, and more to discover and refine the why, what, how, and for whom of our products. You will provide direction and mentorship to junior designers on the team. • Plan and lead meetings and work around assigned initiatives, understanding customer needs and wants, especially related to particular product features and functions

• Design wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, and interactive prototypes

• 5+ years of experience
• Graduate degree or higher in a relevant field or similar work experience
• Extensive experience with User Experience design
• Excellent collaboration and communication skills
• Expert knowledge of product design principles
• Ability to translate business and customer requirements into sublime product experiences

• Visual design principles (color theory, typography, composition)
• Interaction design principles (user flows, affordances, feedback)
• Information architecture and design (organizing and structuring information)
• User research methods (interviews, surveys, usability testing)
• Prototyping techniques and tools (low-fidelity sketches, wireframes, high-fidelity mockups)
• Practical experience with accessibility guidelines and best practices
• Knowledge of web and mobile design standards and technologies (responsive design, CSS, HTML, JavaScript)
• Experience with designing, running, and analyzing usability tests and design experiments
• Experience designing for mobile apps (iOS, Android, Windows, etc.) and the mobile web

• Knowledge of front-end development and ability to work with devtools
• Familiarity with data visualization and dashboard design
• Experience leading design sprints and facilitating workshops with cross-functional teams
• Strong leadership skills and experience mentoring junior designers
• Experience working with international or multilingual products and users

About Sora Schools

Sora is the virtual private middle and high school turning today’s students into tomorrow’s change-makers. We are a full-time school program accredited by Cognia, WASC, and approved by the NCAA.

Our mission is simple: build the replacement to the broken U.S. education system. No compromises, no reform. Most schools continue to do the same things they’ve always done: making students memorize content, test them, score them, and rank them. Unsurprisingly, students are losing their creativity and motivation, and are utterly unprepared to succeed in the real world.

In our virtual program, middle and high school students work on passion-based projects that they get to create and take wherever they wish. They don’t spend their school hours attending lecture-based classes and don’t read many traditional textbooks — instead, they’re building video games, writing fantasy novels, conducting scientific research, and more! They connect with industry mentors to expose them to new careers and fields of study. Students learn not only the full breadth of academic subjects but also important soft skills and subjects such as financial literacy, philosophy, and more. Our school is organized in small, tight-knit cohorts so every group of students and faculty can feel close and engaged in their community. We’ve embarked on our journey to accelerate students toward their wildest dreams. We can’t wait for you to join us!

The Role

Sora is in-process of rebranding and redesigning all its digital touch points - this is the best time for a designer to join the team to innovate and design educational experiences that are engaging, intuitive, and impactful.

We are also scaling product design, service design, visual design, and the research team from the ground up. Senior Graphic Designer

Why we have this Role

Qualtrics is seeking an exceptional senior designer to create compelling product content and sales enablement assets across our Customer Experience, People Teams, and Strategy & Research lines of business. These products help companies create exceptional customer frontlines, high-performing teams, and products people love. All on one platform.

In this capacity, you will play a lead role in the production of compelling content and assets to enable our Field teams – including Sales, Customer Success, Pre-Sales, and Services – and to make them more effective and efficient in their roles. You will report directly to the Lead of our Content Production team based in Mexico City.

How You’ll Find Success

This role sits at the heart of our new Product Content Studio and is responsible for graphic design and visual story-telling across multiple forms of product content. You will work as part of a team within the Studio of copywriters, graphic designers, video producers, localization analysts, and program managers to produce these assets.

You will build a strong understanding of the Qualtrics business and combine this with excellent graphic design and communication skills to produce compelling and differentiated assets that arm our sellers to win and advance opportunities. You’ll have a strong attention to detail and a firm grasp of how to prioritize your work based on the biggest impact. Your role requires you to be adept at stakeholder management across the PMM teams who are experts in our buyer, our Brand Strategy & Activation team, as well as other members of the Content Studio.

How You’ll Grow

You will have the opportunity to play a pivotal role in the success of our Product Marketing Organization (PMM) – a fast-paced and strategic function sitting in the middle of Product, Marketing, and the Field which enables our Go-to-Market teams to be more productive by delivering consistent and focused messaging & content. In this role, you will be a founding member of our new Product Content Studio, which reports to PMM. This role will allow you to build your expertise in Product and Go-To-Market strategy, cross-functional collaboration, and operational excellence.

Things You’ll Do
• Content Creation: Create engaging and informative graphics and visuals for a variety of product assets including pitch decks, one-pagers, email sequences, RFP booklets, and competitive battle cards.
• Design and Branding: In partnership with our Brand Strategy & Activation team, ensure that all product content, both online and offline, adhere to brand guidelines.
• Email Sequences: Design engaging email templates, banners, and graphics for sales and SDR email sequences that generate opportunities and sales pipeline.
• Website Graphics: Collaborate with the web development team to create user-friendly website graphics for our product pages.
• Product Graphics: Produce graphics that visually represent the features, benefits, and user interfaces of our software solutions for use in product documentation and presentations.
• Illustration and Icons: Create icons and visual elements to enhance our product content and documentation.
• Video Graphics: Work closely with video producers to create graphics and animations for product demos.
• Print Materials: In partnership with our Brand Strategy & Activation team, design print materials for trade shows, events, and promotional materials to showcase our product offerings.
• Market Research: Stay up-to-date with design trends, competitors' visuals, and best practices in graphic design to ensure our designs are fresh and innovative.

What We’re Looking For On Your Resume
• Proven Experience: A minimum of 10 years of experience as a graphic designer, preferably in an agency or a B2B marketing or sales enablement setting.
• Bachelor's degree and/or equivalent
• Strong Command of the English language. Please apply with an English resume as this will be a 100% English role.
• Exceptional Graphic Design Skills: Through your experience in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, or a related field. Able to create visual assets that communicate effectively, succinctly, and persuasively
• Proficiency in graphic design software, including Adobe Creative Suite. Figma is a plus.
• Solid understanding of user experience (UX) design principles.
• Creativity: A creative mindset with the ability to generate original ideas and innovative solutions.
• Time Management: Strong organizational and time management skills to meet deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
• Team Player: Excellent collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
• Portfolio: A portfolio of previous work showcasing a diverse range of graphic design and the ability to adapt to different styles and industries.

• Sits at the center of our efforts to bring experience management and product innovation to the market
• Has high visibility and deep collaboration opportunities across all major functions in our PXE (Product, Experience Design, Engineering) and GTM (Go-To-Market - Sales, Services, Pre-Sales, Marketing) organizations
• Embraces their role as the voice of the market to product and the voice of product to the market, spending significant time in the Field with customers and sales representatives to understand customer needs

These purposeful in-person days in thoughtfully designed offices help us do our best work and harness the power of collaboration and innovation. For the rest of the week, work where you want, owning the integration of work and life.

Being together will help us learn more, grow faster and ultimately deliver better results for our customers and Qualtrics. Roles tied to an office location work 4 days per week in the office together and 1 day from home, with a strong spirit of flexibility around taking time for personal, health, and family moments in our work weeks. Our managers work with their teams to create a collaborative, engaged work environment, and arrangement that works for each of our team members.

El equipo de Zillow Experience Design (ZxD) es un equipo de diseño de producto dinámico, colaborativo y motivado. Somos un grupo unido, divertido y optimista. Conócenos y aprende más en https://www.zillow.com/careers/design

Nuestro equipo se preocupa profundamente por resolver problemas para personas reales: clientes, compañeros de trabajo y todos los demás. Buscamos hacer todo un poco mejor de lo que lo encontramos.

As a Senior Product Designer, you’re responsible for understanding customer needs, developing ideas and direction, and working with product teams to deliver outstanding customer experiences. Our mission is to make Zillow the most-loved place to discover, buy, sell, or rent a home.

job_description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that’s what we’re doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we’ve still got a long way to go... fancy joining us?

The design team

We are a team of 32 designers with different skills and it’s distributed among multiple geographies across Spain. We are divided into 3 main areas: Product Design, Core Design, and Marketing Design, and we are integrated into different squads with the aim of devising, designing, and developing the entire experience of our products, brands, campaigns, and comms.

We work daily with user research and data teams that help us to make better decisions based on people and data, and maintain a close relationship with product managers and developers in order to validate and put into production well-designed and well-executed experiences.

We see ourselves as a humble and fun team self-demanding and committed at the same time and we are looking for ways to have fun together doing design-related activities such as: learning from others in our Design Workshops, providing feedback at our Design Rodeos and evolving our Design System in our Mobile, Desktop, Advertising and Comms Glues. This helps us to continue improving as a team, to get to know each other more on the personal side, and build strengths that help us professionally.

The role

As a Product Designer at Cabify, you will be working in one of our different groups such as Business, Delivery, Driver, Fleet, Marketplace or Rider. We expect you to design intuitive and beautiful experiences that solve real customer problems, while producing a positive impact to our KPIs. You will work daily with other people on your squad such as Product Managers, Engineering Managers, Software Engineers and you will also work closely with Data Scientists and User Researches, all of it to define and ship products that have an impact in our cities.

The day-to-day life of the Product Designer is a balance between working closely with your squad and systematizing your solutions with the rest of the Design Team. Some examples of projects you will be working on are:
• Redesign the Support experience of Driver and Rider Apps.
• Design a new solution for fleet managers.
• Evolve our Rider app iterating features and facing users usability problems.
• Evolve our Driver app with new features that enhances our drivers life.
• Create a better experience for travel managers in our Business platform.
• Redesign the sign up experience for all our products.
• Design a new element within the Design System and share it with the team.
• Learn from your mates in different disciplines like interaction, illustration or typography.
• Share your deep knowledge in a specific field within the team.

What are we looking for

If you are interested, we think that you would be a good fit if you have:
• Great alignment with our principles.
• Ability to know how to connect features, balancing the execution of a quick-win and a complete experience redesign.
• A mindset to design proposals that push the metrics in the direction we desire.
• Interest on understanding technology because it help us design more simple and effective solutions.
• A research attitude to aim to make more informed decisions.
• Strong interaction design skills to help people achieve a given task in a simple and intuitive way by designing a user interface.
• The ability to create visual design experiences that are not only useful but that trigger emotions and connections with our users, shaping perception and driving behaviour, thus driving the business.
• A clear and concise communication skills that helps deliver ideas, paving the way for other people to fully understand them.
• Ability to create and document design deliverables in a clean, precise and ordered manner.
• Last and most important, humble attitude and motivation to work with a passionate team.

And some bonus points:
• You have a strong system thinking approach for your proposals.
• You know how to invest your time to get the most out of it to produce an impact.
• You are able to receive feedback and think critically about your work.
• You have experience working with remote team members.
• For sure, you don't need to check all the boxes to be a good match.

The offer

We’re a company full of happy, motivated people and we never want that to change. Here are some more reasons why it rocks to be part of our family:
• Excellent salary conditions for different levels: L3 [35-48K€], L4 [45-55K€]
• Recharge day: Every 3rd Friday of monthly rest (except April and December)
• Flexible hours where you design your own schedule (truly). We don't count hours, we only measure delivery.
• A career path to encourage your professional growth inside the company. You will always know what the next step looks like.
• Remote work, at least 2 days per week you choose your workplace.
• Great atmosphere at work, awesome offices, coffee, and free fruit daily.
• Horizontal hierarchy, your opinion will have great value in the team's decision making.
• Limited free Cabify trips.
• A pet room so you don't have to leave your furry friend at home
• Optional payment of restaurant tickets, transport pass, medical insurance or nursery.

Cabify is proud of being an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age or ability. Join us!

We are looking for multi-faceted Product Designers who design clever interactions, high quality visuals and engaging experiences based on a deep understanding of users and the complexity of their needs, tasks and objectives.

OTA-LAD-MX

Senior Product Designers are responsible for:
• Building deep understanding of customers, stakeholders, business requirements, products and technologies.
• Designing and envisioning concepts and experiences to customer needs and objectives
• Adopt and extend the design style guide, patterns and templates
• Presenting concept visualization through sketches, wireframes, visuals and prototypes

• Quickly respond and adapt designs to (customer) feedback and business requirements
• Getting it done - Delivering designs and solutions at high quality and on schedule
• Understanding design trends within the scope of the industry
• Working with a wide range of media, including Figma
• Prioritize and manage multiple projects within design specifications and timeline restrictions

Senior Product designers at Oracle work on varied and complex projects and systems targeted to a professional audience. Typically, senior designers have 5-7 years of experience in product design or related field and a BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area.

The work you’ll do is…

Transformative not incremental
We are creating a culture of patient learning. We won’t rest…until we are delivering a state-of-the-art user experience for our customers, our partners, as well as our employees. We are a group of thousands of multi-disciplinary creatives from around the globe, dedicated to making the design profession more accessible and inclusive. Come and join our diverse and dynamic team to create state-of-the-art applications that connect, empower, and delight our users. We have design studios in Silicon Valley, Seattle and Guadalajara, Mexico. If you’re interested, please get in touch. We’d love to hear from you. We are excited to work with you!

Human-led
People/customers are at the center of everything we do and showing humanity in our approach.
You will connect and partner with customers to understand their objectives and their users’ needs. Empathize with them, and envision what might make their workflows and experiences dramatically better. Conduct explorative and evaluative user research studies and interviews to identify or verify needs, objectives and workflows. Evaluate experiences to assess discoverability, usability, accessibility and desirability.

Superb craftmanship
We are committed to delivering a state-of-the-art user experience for our customers, our partners, as well as our employees. We get stuff done.
You will be designing solutions from concept, wireframes and prototypes to detailed, visually polished and scalable experiences, ready for implementation. Incorporate feedback quickly and adapt to changes in business requirements and timelines without compromising quality. Leverage the existing design style guide and system, templates and components where possible - create new patterns experiences where needed. Own & drive the experience of our products - and experience the incredible impact of your work will have on our customers.

Bold, aspirational, exciting
We create solutions that span not just the depth and breadth of the challenges our customers face, but come from our diverse employee base, is core to our DNA. A modern user experience is not modern if it's one-size-fits-all.
You will be working closely with kind, curious and smart designers, researchers, writers, product managers, and engineers across the globe. Innovation starts with inclusion – everyone’s voice is heard and valued.

• 5+ years of experience in UX or product design
• BS or MS degree relevant to product design or a proven track-record in a relevant discipline
• Portfolio demonstrating clever and beautiful user centered designs for products, applications and/or services. Experience in shipping (SaaS) applications is a plus.
• Demonstrate approach and experience in gathering requirements, including user research, and defining objectives and opportunities for projects and assignments
• Present (and defend) solutions, approach and choices made along the way
• Excellence in using Figma to create and communicate concepts, wireframes and detailed design solutions

Grow your career (and portfolio)
Development is our priority. Take your career to the next level with world-class learning opportunities, extend your portfolio by designing and shipping products that touch the lives of millions of people, close collaboration with and mentorship by a multidisciplinary team of experts to deepen your knowledge and practice new skills in a variety of design disciplines including Strategy & Innovation, User Experience & User Interface (UI) Design, Visual/Motion Design, User Research, Prototyping, UX Writing, Design Production, and more.

Live well
our benefits are designed to help you lead a balanced life. Be at your best thanks to time off, strong support and great resources.

A diverse and inclusive workplace
Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.

About Sora Schools

Sora is the virtual private middle and high school turning today’s students into tomorrow’s change-makers. We are a full-time school program accredited by Cognia, WASC, and approved by the NCAA.

Our mission is simple: build the replacement to the broken U.S. education system. No compromises, no reform. Most schools continue to do the same things they’ve always done: making students memorize content, test them, score them, and rank them. Unsurprisingly, students are losing their creativity and motivation, and are utterly unprepared to succeed in the real world.

In our virtual program, middle and high school students work on passion-based projects that they get to create and take wherever they wish. They don’t spend their school hours attending lecture-based classes and don’t read many traditional textbooks — instead, they’re building video games, writing fantasy novels, conducting scientific research, and more! They connect with industry mentors to expose them to new careers and fields of study. Students learn not only the full breadth of academic subjects but also important soft skills and subjects such as financial literacy, philosophy, and more. Our school is organized in small, tight-knit cohorts so every group of students and faculty can feel close and engaged in their community. We’ve embarked on our journey to accelerate students toward their wildest dreams. We can’t wait for you to join us!

The Role

We are looking for a Senior User Interface Designer to drive the next stage of Sora's digital platform design.

The platform is critical in delivering an innovative educational experience to students as well as serving the needs of parents, teachers, and staff. As a senior visual designer, you will be responsible for designing for Web and Mobile, and establishing a design system from the ground up. You’ll also influence visual language, branding, marketing, and the end-to-end student, parent, and teacher experience at Sora beyond just digital touch-points.

Sora is in-process of rebranding and redesigning all its digital touch points - this is the best time for a designer to join the team to innovate and design educational experiences that are delightful and compelling.

We are also scaling product design, service design, visual design, and the research team from the ground up. In this role, you will work closely with the Head of Design and Chief Product Officer and alongside some of the best minds in the industry to build something that no one has built before: a digital school that is the most loved high school in the U.S, and one day the rest of the world.

Location and Salary

This is a fully remote position located anywhere in Mexico. We’re excited to build a team with a wide variety of perspectives and backgrounds, and encourage candidates to apply even if they don’t have experience in all the following areas.

We offer a competitive salary and perks based on the in country localized market.

#LI-Remote

What you'll do:
• Work day-to-day with a cross-functional team of engineers, data scientists, producers, and marketing managers to support various communication, marketing, and product visual design needs.
• Work in partnership with UX designers to craft pixel-perfect designs that are intuitive, delightful, and ready to be implemented.
• Incrementally build the platform visual experience at various stages; Lead visual design thinking, UI mockups, storyboards, and share deliverables with stakeholders.
• Design, contribute and maintain the Sora design system.
• Communicate cross-functionally and advocate for the users at all organizational levels.
• Contribute, collaborate and grow with a talented and devoted team to improve the education system in the US and globally.

What we're looking for:
• 5+ years of professional experience in User Interface Design, Production Design, or related fields as an individual contributor in an agency and/or in-house creative environment.
• An online portfolio demonstrating your strong visual design craft through web and mobile projects (required in application).
• Experience designing for consumer-facing web and mobile products with a focus on visual design language, design systems, illustrations, typography, etc.
• Mastery of design tools like Figma, Sketch, Invision, and Adobe Suite.
• Strong written and verbal skills in English
• A strong lifelong passion for all things visual; someone who has a pulse on trends in design, education, arts, and tech.

And the following traits are an added bonus:
• Motion graphics/animation skills are a major plus for this role.
• Experience in photography, photoshoots, and video production.
• Passion for print and communication design (Posters, SWAG)
• Experience contributing, improving, maintaining, and implementing design systems.
• Experience in designing for the education sector.

Working at Sora Schools

Sora offers a collaborative, team-oriented environment with colleagues who deeply care about our mission. We’re fully remote with members living around the world, offer all full-time team members stock options, and believe in flexibility to ensure we can all live a full life.

Equal opportunity statement

Sora Schools is an equal opportunity employer that is deeply committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, age, gender, religious or political beliefs, national origin or heritage, marital status, disability, sex, sexual orientation or gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy, status as a protected veteran or any characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion not only reflects our values but also enriches our ability to do our work.

Accommodation request

Please let your Sora contact know if you would like to request reasonable accommodations during your application or interviewing process.

Background check

All full-time team members are required to go through a background screening prior to employment upon hire. Additionally, if you are based in the U.S., we are required to complete an I-9 to confirm to show that you are authorized to work in the United States.

job_description:
Oracle Design

Oracle is a multinational computer technology corporation, with offices across the world, including the United States, Canada and Mexico.

We build cloud applications and cloud platform services that help people and companies see data in new ways, discover insights, unlock endless possibilities.

Entrepreneurial , not incremental

We are creating a culture of patient learning. We won’t rest until we are delivering an innovative user experience for our customers, our partners, as well as our employees.

We are a group of thousands of multi-disciplinary creatives from around the globe, dedicated to making the design profession more accessible and inclusive.

Come and join our diverse and dynamic team to create state-of-the-art applications that connect, empower, and delight our users.

We have design studios across the globe and also in Guadalajara, Mexico. If you’re interested, please get in touch. We’d love to hear from you.

We are excited to work with you!

The job

Our design team works on a wide variety of products and services such as Customer Service and Sales (CX), Marketing (CMX), Supply Chain Management (SCM), Resource management (ERP), Human Capital Management (HCM).

The HCM design team is responsible for the design of Oracle’s HCM cloud applications. We are looking for multi-faceted Product Designers to design resourceful interactions, high-quality visuals and engaging experiences based on a deep understanding of our users & customers, and the complexity of their needs, tasks and objectives.

We often work in close collaboration with our customers and get the opportunity to see the impact of our work on their work lives.

The role of designers at Oracle includes the following :
• Building a deep understanding of customers, team members, business requirements, products, and technologies.
• Designing and envisioning concepts and experiences to customer needs and objectives
• Adopt and extend the design style guide, patterns, and templates
• Communicating concept visualization through sketches, wireframes, visuals, and prototype
• Effectively and appropriately using sketches, wireframes, visuals, motion and prototyping to present concepts and turn functional solutions into compelling, consumer-grade experiences
• Quickly respond and adapt designs to (customer) feedback and business requirements
• Getting it done - Delivering designs and solutions at high quality and on schedule
• Understanding design trends within the scope of the industry
• Working with a wide range of media, including Figma
• Prioritize and handle multiple projects within design specifications and timeline restrictions

The work you’ll do is

Human-led

People / customers are at the center of everything we do, and we show humanity in our approach.

You will connect and partner with customers to understand their objectives and their users’ needs. Empathize with them, and envision what might make their workflows and experiences spectacularly better.

Conduct explorative and evaluative user research studies and interviews to identify or verify needs, objectives, and workflows.

Evaluate experiences to assess discoverability, usability, accessibility, and desirability.

Superb craftsmanship

We are committed to delivering a powerful user experience for our customers, our partners, as well as our employees. We get stuff done.

You will be designing solutions from concepts, wireframes, and prototypes to detailed, visually polished, and scalable experiences, ready for implementation.

Incorporate feedback quickly and adapt to changes in business requirements and timelines without compromising quality. Leverage the existing design style guide and system, templates, and components where possible - create new patterns and experiences where needed.

Own & drive the experience of our products - and experience the incredible impact of your work will have on our customers.

Daring , aspirational, exciting

We create solutions that span not just the depth and breadth of the challenges our customers face, but come from our diverse employee base, which is core to our DNA.

A modern user experience is not modern if it's one-size-fits-all.

You will be working closely with kind, curious, and thoughtful designers, researchers, writers, product managers, and engineers across the globe.

Innovation starts with inclusion everyone’s voice is heard and valued.

What you’ll bring
• Validated experience in UX or product design
• BS or MS degree relevant to product design or a validated track record in a relevant discipline
• Portfolio demonstrating sensible and appealing user-centered designs for products, applications and / or services. Experience in shipping (SaaS) applications is a plus.
• Demonstrate approach and experience in gathering requirements, including user research, and defining objectives and opportunities for projects and assignments
• Present (and defend) solutions, approaches and choices made along the way
• Excellence in using Figma to create and communicate concepts, wireframes and detailed design solutions

What we’ll give you

Grow your career (and portfolio)

Development is our priority. Take your career to the next level with extraordinary learning opportunities, extend your portfolio by designing and shipping products that touch the lives of millions of people, and close collaboration with and mentorship by a multidisciplinary team of guides to deepen your knowledge and practice new skills in a variety of design subject areas including Strategy & Innovation, User Experience & User Interface (UI) Design, Visual / Motion Design, User Research, Prototyping, UX Writing, Design Production, and more.

Live well

Our benefits are designed to help you lead a balanced life. Be at your best thanks to time off, strong support and great resources.

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work.

It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with a diverse group of backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

As a member of the User Experience team, you will develop and apply software design / usability processes in the investigation of technical problems.

May develop user profiles, with emphasis on human error control, display issues, visual interaction, physical manipulation and task and objective analyses.

Provide product usability, evaluation and support to product development teams, including the analysis and investigation of applications / systems including tactile methods, visual graphics, web, multimedia, voice response and conversational user interaction.

May assist in developing design concept and implementation, providing input on user design considerations. May produce specifications describing user needs and internal structures for product in development.

Want to do meaningful design work at a mission-driven company, and have a real impact on the lives of millions of people working in retail? As a Senior Product Designer at Zipline you will do just that – solving complex and interesting problems that help retail workers keep their day on track.

At Zipline, our mission is to bring retail operations out of the dark ages and give companies effective tools that their employees love to use. You will help improve the way that this 4.4 trillion dollar industry communicates with its store employees and save them from sad, slow, inefficient systems (think fax machines, voicemails, and the postal service). People deserve better! We need your help to make this happen.

We are a well-funded market leader and have great customers, but there is so much more to do and improve. We are looking for a Senior Product Designer to collaborate daily with product and engineering to drive concepts from idea to design to launch – balancing strategic direction with tactical execution to create high quality solutions our customers will love. You will dive deep into parts of the Zipline product, solving critical user needs and shipping solutions to challenging problems.

The user experience matters to us and our customers (Gap Inc, Allbirds, Lululemon, LEGO, and many more), and we want you to be part of shaping that!

Responsibilities
• Collaborate with Product and Engineering on setting long-term goals and direction, balanced with the incremental steps it will take to get there.
• Drive user research to better understand customer needs and gather feedback on concepts and solutions.
• Design flows, sketches, prototypes, UI, visual design, and more that solves customer needs and problems.
• Solicit feedback from your teammates and colleagues on the effectiveness of your ideas and design solutions.
• Facilitate design discussions, drive alignment on solutions, iterate on use cases and constraints, and ensure a high-quality UI and experience for our users.
• Execute quickly and efficiently, iterating and improving our product over time.
• Contribute to improving team processes and operations as part of a remote organization – demonstrating good communication and collaboration through leading by example.
• Promote a collaborative and inclusive environment for the team.

Must-haves
• 5+ years experience designing UX/UI solutions for desktop and mobile.
• Outstanding portfolio showcasing a foundation in information architecture, UI & interaction design, visual design, and working with design systems.
• Experience driving user interviews and concept testing with customers.
• Experience partnering with Product and Engineering to develop the rationale, options, and execution plans for your features.

More about you
• Retail experience is an asset, but not required
• Proficient in tools such as Figma, Slack, Google Docs, etc
• Ability to act with empathy and intentionality towards customers and colleagues.
• Ability to listen, understand, share, and collaborate with your teammates.
• Self-motivated, curious, and dependable.

Employee Benefits
• Stock Options
• Paid Flexible Time Off (including time off to care for family members, as well as Sick Time)
• Paid Parental Leave Benefit
• Group Health Insurance (Medical, Vision, and Dental) with a variety of PPO & HMO plans and a flexible spending account
• 401(k) Retirement Plan
• 100% Paid Life and Long-Term Disability Insurance

The “Extras”
• Remote Work: Join a flexible, effective remote team and work where you’re comfortable- literally anywhere! We’ve had Zipliners join us from vans, RVs, sailboats, and AirBnBs around the globe.
• Computer accessories and office setup: There’s a science to being effective at home and we help you get there with the right equipment and accessories that you need.
• Company off-sites: Most years we come together (IRL!). Past retreats were held in Santa Cruz, New York, Mexico City, Puerto Vallarta, and Costa Rica.
• Education stipends: We believe in perpetual learning! If there’s a class that you want to take or a book that will help you expand your horizons, we’ll support it, as long as it fits within our team budgets.
• Coffee Stipend: To encourage breaks and a change of scenery, we provide a small stipend each month to get you out of the house and relax at your favourite coffee spot.

A note on our Flexible Time Off Policy – We don’t have a set number of “Days Off” at Zipline, and instead Zipliners request time off when and as they need it, under a Flexible Time Off Policy. Each request is then reviewed by your manager and a decision is made with all of the appropriate business considerations accounted for. Typically, we see Zipliners using 15-25 days per year, and it’s important to note that time off is not unlimited.

We value diversity of all kinds and are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other. We are an equal-opportunity employer and welcome people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives.

Got More Time, here’s more about Zipline!

How do we work?Remotely. We have been 100% remote since the company was founded. We come together as a company every week for our Wednesdays Socials, where the topic can be a classic “Standup” format, a micro learning around burnout and mental health, followed by discussion, or a silly trivia…and anything in between! Some Fridays, we come together to learn from each other. One week it might be about opossum rescue. Another week it might be an update on our product roadmap or the results of our customer satisfaction survey. We are all expert Zoom navigators, and love the freedom of working from anywhere, using technology to connect.

With Zipline, retail employees feel more connected, understand the role they play in the brand’s mission, and can feel good about the work they’re doing. This is important to us because retail is one of America’s most populous workforces but also one of the most underserved. Through Zipline, we can touch on one in four American workers whose jobs and needs are often underrepresented.

We have made incredible progress but changing the industry is hard. We are well funded by leading venture capital firms like Emergence Capital and ready to scale. We need your help to improve the way that this 4.4 trillion dollar industry communicates with its store employees. Cumbersome, slow, and inefficient systems should not be the status quo. Help us retool retail, and Keep Today on Track

Please let know you found this position on DesignX Job Board as a way to support us so we can keep fostering this community.

About Twinkl

For over a decade now we have been providing educators across the world with high quality, trusted teaching resources for their classrooms, homes and learning centres.

This role

As a Graphic Designer at Twinkl, you’ll join a small production team made up of Teacher Content Writers, Teacher Content Editors, Illustrators and Graphic Designers to produce a wide variety of beautiful learning materials that will be downloaded, printed, and utilised for learning in education settings around the world. The resource types and age range you will be working on will depend on the team you join. As such, you should be passionate about education and excited to contribute to a market-leading business that helps teachers spend more time with children and less time doing the admin that surrounds it.

A little about the culture within design

This position is a 12-month contract for 37.5 hours per week of work. As a self-employed position, it comes with lots of flexibility in how you manage your schedule, but unlike many other freelance roles you’ll be welcomed into and feel very much a part of a focused team that meets regularly via video call, collaborates together and works closely as its own production unit.
